name: Fort Larned National Historic Site
description: Discover a complete and authentic army post from the 1860s -1870s! This well-preserved fort on the Santa Fe Trail shares a tumultuous history of the Indian Wars era. The sandstone constructed buildings sheltered troops who were known as the Guardians of the Santa Fe Trail.
shortDescription: Discover a complete and authentic army post from the 1860s -1870s! This well-preserved fort on the Santa Fe Trail shares a tumultuous history of the Indian Wars era. The sandstone constructed building...

operatingHours.description: Staff begin closing the grounds and visitor center at 4:30 p.m. The parking lot gate is closed and locked for the night at 5 p.m.

climate.weatherDescription: Central Kansas has a four-season climate. Winter tends to be cold and dry, with average daytime highs below 40F (4C). Foehn winds blowing across the Great Plains from the Southwest periodically raise temperatures above 80F (27C). Unsettled warmer air, higher winds, and severe weather arrive in the spring and often last through early July. Late summer days hover above 90F (32C) and readings over 100F (38C) are not uncommon. Fall is variable but generally milder with showers changing to snow and ice later.

images.title: Artillery Demonstration
images.altText: Men in 19th century U.S. Army uniforms fire a reproduction period cannon.
images.caption: Volunteers demonstrating the use of a mountain howitzer during one of Fort Larned's living history weekends.

images.title: Aerial Photo of Fort Larned
images.altText: Sandstone army buildings arranged in a square around parade ground.
images.caption: The historic sandstone buildings at Fort Larned date to 1868

images.title: Blacksmith Demonstrations at Fort Larned
images.altText: Man in leather apron hammering hot steel in blacksmith shop.
images.caption: The blacksmith demonstration is one of the most popular living history demonstrations.

images.title: Flag Retreat
images.altText: Men in 19th century U.S. Army uniforms lower an American flag.
images.caption: Volunteers help recreate the U.S. Army flag lowering ceremony known as Retreat.

images.title: Visitors in the Barracks
images.altText: Man in 19th century U.S. Army uniform interacts with visitors in period barracks.
images.caption: A volunteer shows visitors how soldiers lived during the 1860s at Fort Larned.

images.title: Visiting Santa
images.altText: Three young children having their picture taken with Santa Claus in a period room.
images.caption: Young visitors get their picture taken with Santa during the fort's Christmas Past event.

images.title: Buffalo Soldiers
images.altText: African American men in 19th century cavalry uniforms on horseback.
images.caption: Buffalo Soldier re-enactors help bring Fort Larned's history to life.
